body_html:
Here's another user who is saying TensorFlow tries to allocate 55GB of virtual memory for trivial computation which is a problem for Open Grid Scheduler https://stackoverflow.com/q/46114462/419116

They are suggesting it's the CUDA driver trying to allocate this memory, maybe there's some other CUDA flag to disable this behavior.

As a sanity check, does any other CUDA framework (ie, PyTorch) have same problem on your cluster?
